From: "Gordon Paynter" <Gordon.Paynter@...>
Subject: Visualising and browsing ARC files
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=235746949

Hi all:

Can anyone recommend any tools for visualising or browsing the con=
tents of a set of ARC files returned by a crawl?

Some of our (largely non-=
technical) librarians are using HTTrack to download sites, and I am testing=
 Heretrix on the same sites. We want to be able to visualise the result of =
the two crawls, so we can spot the material that HTTrack is missing (on som=
e sites there is a lot of it).

Our preference is to do this in an HTTrack-=
like format.  For those of you who haven't used HTTrack, it is not designed=
 for archiving; it is designed as an offline Web site reader.  This means i=
t downloads files from a site(s), and creates a directory tree that loosely=
 replicates the site as static HTML.  All HTML inks are converted to relati=
ve links so that the directory tree can be browsed with a web browser and w=
ill appear similar to the original site.

It should be fairly straightforwa=
rd to write a program that reads a set of ARC files, grabs the HTML Pages, =
tweaks the links, writes them to an HTTrack-like browsable directory tree. =
Does anyone know if such a program already exists?

Finally, can anyone rec=
ommend any tools for browsing or visualising the content of the set of ARC =
files generated from a single crawl.

Thanks,
Gordon
